meanings.definition: To add excessive decoration or detail to something.
meanings.sent1: She kept overembellishing her drawings with too many colors and sparkles.
meanings.sent2: The designer was overembellishing the dress with unnecessary sequins.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't help overembellishing the cake with an entire garden of frosting flowers.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to dance, overembellishing the canvas with vibrant strokes.
meanings.sent5: The room was overembellished with so many decorations that it felt overwhelming.

meanings.definition: To exaggerate or elaborate on a story or account.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman enjoyed overembellishing his fishing tales to make them more exciting.
meanings.sent2: She was overembellishing the details of her vacation to impress her friends.
meanings.sent3: The comedian couldn't resist overembellishing his jokes to get more laughs.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination ran wild, overembellishing the story until it became a fantastical adventure.
meanings.sent5: The author's words overembellished the scene, painting a vivid picture in the reader's mind.
